application_protocol.name: configuration_control_3d_design_ed2
application_protocol.name.french: Conceptions 3D contrôlées de configuration de pièces mécaniques et des assemblages
application_protocol.title: Configuration controlled 3D design of mechanical parts and assemblies (modular version)
application_protocol.purpose: the exchange of configuration-controlled 3D designs of mechanical parts and assemblies

abstract.p: This part of ISO 10303 was updated to conform to ISO 10303-11:2004, harmonized with ISO 10303-214, and extended to provide additional PDM capabilities;
This document includes the scope of the AP module and provides a planning model and conformance class information.

change_summary.p: This part was updated to use EXPRESS Edition 2, harmonized with 214, and extended to provide additional PDM capabilities. A brief summary of the modifications follows:

ul.li: Added geometric presentation structures that includes colours, layers and groups;
Normatively reference all of the current second edition and technical corrigendum parts of ISO 10303.

annex_clause.title: Introduction
annex_clause.p: This annex contains the documented changes from the first edition of ISO 10303–203 . Care was taken to manage the upward compatibility of with this part of ISO 10303. This is discussed in detail in .
Many of the changes in this document are due to EXPRESS changes in the following parts of this International Standard:
Technical modifications to ISO 10303–203 are categorized as follows:

li.p: data types have been renamed to be harmonized with other parts of this International Standard;
li.note: the deprecated data types are retained for upward compatibility

ul.li: EXPRESS declarations have been modified to be harmonized with other parts of this International Standard;
additional EXPRESS has been declared in order to cover additional scope;
The use of EXPRESS declarations have been deprecated.

annex_clause.title: Modifications to entities for name harmonization
annex_clause.p: In table H.1 below, each row is a mapping from an entity name as declared in ISO/IS 10303-203 name to a harmonized name in this part of ISO 10303. The first column gives the name of an entity data type declared in the common resources. Column 2 gives the name of the specialization that is declared in ISO/IS 10303-203 . Column 3 gives the name of the corresponding data type as declared in this part of ISO 10303. Details of the additional changes follow the table. Any changes in the column 1 entities are also noted.
Rows 1- 2: entity names only changed from Column 2 to Column 3.
Row 3 – 7: entity names and additional changes are noted below, followed by the EXPRESS.
annex_clause.annex_clause:
The select data type contracted_item is replaced by contract_item with action added to SELECT list.
ISO/IS 10303-203 EXPRESS:
EXPRESS in this part of ISO 10303:

person_organization_item is replaced by person_and_organization_item with several changes to SELECT lists that are discussed in H.2.5.
ISO/IS 10303-203[4] EXPRESS:
Edition 2 EXPRESS

cc_design_date_and_time_assignment is renamed and the WHERE rule is removed.
ISO 10303-203 EXPRESS:
EXPRESS in this part of ISO 10303:

specified_item is replaced by document_reference_item with action_method, product_definition_relationship, shape_aspect_relationship, versioned_action_request, product, product_definition, and product_definition_formation added to document_reference_item SELECT list.
ISO/IS 10303-203[4] EXPRESS:
Edition 2 EXPRESS

annex_clause.title: Related changes
annex_clause.annex_clause: The action_assignment supertype (Part 41 entity) had a derived attribute and a where rule added. The entities change and start_work were replaced by applied_action_assignment with action_items having additional entities in the SELECT list.
annex_clause.p: EXPRESS in this part of ISO 10303:
annex_clause.annex_clause: The entity data types change_request and start_request have been replaced by applied_action_assignment with action_request_item having additional entities in the SELECT list. the part 41 entity action_request_assignment was modified by adding a derived attribute and a where rule.
annex_clause.p: EXPRESS in this part of ISO 10303:

annex_clause.annex_clause:
security_classification_assignment supertype (Part 41) has a new derived attribute and a where rule. The security_classification_item has some additional entities in the SELECT list.
ISO/IS 10303-203[4] EXPRESS:
ENTITY security_classification_assignment ABSTRACT SUPERTYPE; assigned_security_classification: security_classification; END_ENTITY; -- security_classification_assignment ENTITY cc_design_security_classification SUBTYPE OF (security_classification_assignment); items : SET [1:?] OF classified_item; END_ENTITY; -- cc_design_security_classification TYPE classified_item = SELECT (product_definition_formation, assembly_component_usage); END_TYPE; -- classified_item

purpose.p: The Configuration controlled design 3D design of mechanical parts and assemblies application protocol (AP) supports the requirement to represent occurrences or instances of parts in assemblies and in assemblies of assemblies.
purpose.note: It is an AP created entirely from modules and is referred to as a modular AP.
purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application protocol for the use of product data within a defined context which satisfies an industrial need to exchange configuration-controlled 3D product design data of mechanical parts and assemblies. In order to specify the composition of products, organizations use many computer-based application systems. Integral to the definition of a product are the specification of its shape, the specification of its configurations and the applicability of its possibly multiple definitions to a particular configuration. This data may reside on one or more application systems within an organization. The integration of the data that defines the shape of a product with the data concerning its configuration is essential to an organization's ability to define its products without relying on redundant data in disparate application systems. In order for the definition of the design of products to be communicated, an organization must be able to share its product data with partners, vendors, and customers.
The activities addressed in this application protocol are described in . They include:

ul.li: identification of a product to an organization's customers and of the components which comprise the product;
description of the shape of the components of a product;
documentation of formal change and release of designs for the product;
tracking of the history of the product as it goes through the formal initiation, change and release process;
identification of qualified suppliers for the product or the design of the product.

definition.def: the period during which the engineering representation of a product is dynamic
a physical object which can be formed from material into a static shape
a complete 3D representation of the nominal shape of a product so that any point in space can be determined to be inside, on the boundary, or outside the solid model
a constituent that is an assembly

description.p: This clause specifies the information requirements for the exchange of configuration-controlled 3D designs of mechanical parts and assemblies. The management of the configuration of products is addressed in this application protocol, and is concerned with authorizations and the associated approvals given by persons in organizations. The structured list of materials or components needed to make a product can be exchanged, along with initial part design requirements as well as requirements for revised part versions. It provides the directive for work to proceed on these initial or modified part versions.

This part provides information about the planned usage of components in a product model, and also includes data about the different products that are sold by an organization to its customers enabling an organization to control the configuration of these products. It contains the structure through which a part, unique versions of a part, and different design discipline views of a part can be defined. Information about an organization that is qualified to product a particular part in included. Various documents and references associated with a product can be exchanged using this part.

The different shape representations for products that are provided include solid modeling: advanced boundary representation, faceted boundary representation, and constructive solid geometry. Also, surface and wire frame representations with and without topological structures are included. The validation of solid or surface exchanges can be facilitated using properties such as center of gravity and wetted area. Associative three-dimensional text along with dimensional and geometric tolerances provide additional capabilities for product exchanges.

ISO 10303-403
defines the full information model for this part of ISO 10303 by providing a single root for all of the modules normatively referenced. The following items are specified:

ul.li: products that are mechanical parts and assemblies;
product definition data and configuration control data pertaining to the design phase of a product's development;
representation of an instance of a part in an assembly through its usage in a sub-assembly;

six groups of shape representations of a part that includes advanced boundary representation, faceted boundary representation, manifold surfaces with topology, geometrically bounded surface and wireframe geometry, wireframe with topology, and constructive solid geometry in three-dimensions;
geometric validation properties to allow the translation of geometric shape representations (advanced boundary representation and faceted boundary representation solids) to be checked for quality;
geometric presentation of geometric shape representations by the application of colours, layers and groups;
geometric and dimensional tolerances applied to geometric shape representations;
textual annotation and notes applied to geometric shape representations.

description.p:
ISO 10303-1230
specifies an application module for the representation of data associated with product data management using the application module
ISO 10303-1231
(Product data management). It also enables the representation of mechanical parts and assemblies including product shape, geometric dimensioning and tolerancing, and text annotation, including the following:

ul.li: products that are three-dimensional parts and assemblies;
configuration control data and product definition data;

shape representations that includes advanced boundary representation, faceted boundary representation, manifold manifold surfaces with topology, geometrically bounded surface and wireframe geometry, wireframe with topology, and constructive solid geometry in three-dimensions;
geometric presentation of geometric shape representations by the application of colours, layers and groups;
geometric and dimensional tolerances applied to geometric shape representations;
textual annotation and notes applied to geometric shape representations.

description.p:
ISO 10303-1231
specifies an application module for the representation of data associated with product data management, including the following:
This module provides support for data structures common to many product data management computing systems.

If the implementation method is ISO 10303-21, the file format shall be encoded according to the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and to the MIM schema referenced in of this part of ISO 10303.
